collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (43 total Queries, 43 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Obtain schedules of payables and accruals. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to backing schedules and the trial balance. <strong>(E & C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Ensure payables are properly split between amounts due in less than one year and amounts due in more than one year. Ensure that where balances are shown as non-current that the entity has the legal right to avoid payment for at least 12 months from the reporting date. <strong>(R & O, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Review payables for reasonableness and consistency and ensure that related party balances have been identified. <strong>(P, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Inspect board minutes, loan agreements and other evidence to ascertain whether all debentures and other loans (including bank loans) have been recorded. <strong>(V, R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Obtain counter party confirmation of all debenture and loan account balances (including bank loans). Agree the account balances and ensure all other matters arising are dealt with. <strong>(P, R & O, E, C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. Obtain details of loan covenants and consider as to whether they have been complied with. <strong>(P)</strong></p>\r\n<i>Where a loan covenant has been breached and not rectified by the reporting date and the financial institution has not agreed by the reporting date to ‘overlook’ the breach, the entire loan must be disclosed as repayable within one year. </i>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Review loan agreements (particularly bank loans) to ensure that none of the clauses within the loan agreement trigger the loan being accounted for on a fair value basis. If any loans are to be accounted for at fair value, complete test 39 below. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Discuss with those charged with governance whether, in relation to any loan agreements, they have entered into any interest rate swaps, cap or collar arrangements through a ‘side agreement’ or via a separate contract. <strong>(C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Where such interest rate swaps or loans that need to be accounted for at fair value are identified, ensure the client has obtained an appropriate fair value from the counterparty and complete test 39 below. If hedge accounting is being applied, complete the tests on S2/4.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. Where payable balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception, consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Where loans are due after more than one year and the interest is not spread evenly over the period of the loan (for example, irregular payments throughout the loan term or a balloon payment on completion), ensure that the effective interest rate is calculated and the loan carried at amortised cost. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that cut-off has been correctly applied on loans from subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p> <ul> <li>Management charges;</li> <li>Accrued interest;</li> <li>Dividends still to be paid. <strong>(C)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Where loans payable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate. <strong>(P & V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Obtain an aged payables’ listing and reconcile it to the trade payables figure shown on the lead schedule. <strong>(C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Select a sample of trade payable balances and agree / reconcile them to suppliers’ statements, direct confirmation or purchase invoices. Where the balance is reconciled to supplier statements, follow up any reconciling items and ensure all necessary provisions are included in the financial statements. <strong>(V, R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Ensure that any payables due to be paid in foreign currency have been correctly translated at the period end rate, and ensure there is an adequate accounting policy note. <strong>(V & P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. Ensure cut-off has been properly dealt with. Examine goods received notes either side of the period-end date and ensure recorded in the correct accounting period.<strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Select a sample of after-date purchase invoices, cash book payments, expense claims and transactions on company credit card statements and confirm they represent post period items or are correctly recorded as payables. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>24. Review debit balances included on the payables’ ledger, consider whether they represent unrecorded purchases and if they are bona fide debit balances consider reclassifying as debtors. <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>25. Check supporting documentation for material ‘other payables’, these should include:</p> <ul> <li>Corporation tax;</li> <li>Payroll deductions;</li> <li>Any other material payable balances.<strong> (V, E)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. If any finance lease individually is ‘significant’ ensure it is identified as such and suitable disclosure is included in the financial statements. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>27. Obtain written confirmation of the value of any loans included in ‘other payables’, including any amounts due to related parties. <strong>(V, R & O, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. Ensure all secured payables, including trade payables where goods are under reservation of title (Romalpa Clause), have been identified, and that appropriate disclosure has been made regarding the security. <strong>(P, R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Ensure all payables falling partly or wholly due after more than five years have been identified, and that information relating to additional disclosure can be provided. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. If accruals are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), then recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Review deferred income and ensure that cut-off procedures have been adequately undertaken. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Ensure that any dividends shown in payables are final dividends and were approved prior to the reporting date. <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>33. Ensure that any bonus shown in payables represents either a contractual or constructive obligation at the reporting date.<strong> (R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>34. Scrutinise the purchase ledger and purchases day book for unusual items. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of expenditure. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Financial Instruments</h6>\r\n<p>36. Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. Most financial liabilities will be classified as subsequently measured at amortised cost. However, there are exceptions, as set out in IFRS 9.4.2.1.</p>\r\n<p>Review the entity’s financial liabilities and ensure these are appropriately classified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>38. The entity can designate, on initial recognition, a financial liability at FVTPL if:</p> <ul> <li>• doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”;</li> <li>• a group of financial assets and/or liabilities is managed and performance evaluated on a FV basis; or</li> <li>• it is a certain type of hybrid contract per 4.3.5 of IFRS 9.</li> </ul> <p>If this is the case, ensure such a liability has been treated appropriately from initial recognition</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>39. For any financial liability recognised at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p> <ul> <li>Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li> <li>Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li> <li>If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li> <li>• Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li> <li>• Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li> <li>• Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence</li> </ul> <p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p> <p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>40. If the entity has contracts with embedded derivatives, ensure these have been treated in accordance with IFRS 9.4.3.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6> <p>41. Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL. </p> <p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p> ', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>42. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

Where such interest rate swaps or loans that need to be accounted for at fair value are identified, ensure the client has obtained an appropriate fair value from the counterparty and complete test 39 below. If hedge accounting is being applied, complete the tests on S2/4.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. Where payable balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception, consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Where loans are due after more than one year and the interest is not spread evenly over the period of the loan (for example, irregular payments throughout the loan term or a balloon payment on completion), ensure that the effective interest rate is calculated and the loan carried at amortised cost. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Ensure that cut-off has been correctly applied on loans from subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p> <ul> <li>Management charges;</li> <li>Accrued interest;</li> <li>Dividends still to be paid. <strong>(C)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Where loans payable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate. <strong>(P & V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Obtain an aged payables’ listing and reconcile it to the trade payables figure shown on the lead schedule. <strong>(C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Select a sample of trade payable balances and agree / reconcile them to suppliers’ statements, direct confirmation or purchase invoices. Where the balance is reconciled to supplier statements, follow up any reconciling items and ensure all necessary provisions are included in the financial statements. <strong>(V, R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Ensure that any payables due to be paid in foreign currency have been correctly translated at the period end rate, and ensure there is an adequate accounting policy note. <strong>(V & P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. Ensure cut-off has been properly dealt with. Examine goods received notes either side of the period-end date and ensure recorded in the correct accounting period.<strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. Select a sample of after-date purchase invoices, cash book payments, expense claims and transactions on company credit card statements and confirm they represent post period items or are correctly recorded as payables. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>24. Review debit balances included on the payables’ ledger, consider whether they represent unrecorded purchases and if they are bona fide debit balances consider reclassifying as debtors. <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>25. Check supporting documentation for material ‘other payables’, these should include:</p> <ul> <li>Corporation tax;</li> <li>Payroll deductions;</li> <li>Any other material payable balances.<strong> (V, E)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>26. If any finance lease individually is ‘significant’ ensure it is identified as such and suitable disclosure is included in the financial statements. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>27. Obtain written confirmation of the value of any loans included in ‘other payables’, including any amounts due to related parties. <strong>(V, R & O, E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>28. Ensure all secured payables, including trade payables where goods are under reservation of title (Romalpa Clause), have been identified, and that appropriate disclosure has been made regarding the security. <strong>(P, R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>29. Ensure all payables falling partly or wholly due after more than five years have been identified, and that information relating to additional disclosure can be provided. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>30. If accruals are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), then recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>31. Review deferred income and ensure that cut-off procedures have been adequately undertaken. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>32. Ensure that any dividends shown in payables are final dividends and were approved prior to the reporting date. <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>33. Ensure that any bonus shown in payables represents either a contractual or constructive obligation at the reporting date.<strong> (R&O)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>34. Scrutinise the purchase ledger and purchases day book for unusual items. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>35. Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of expenditure. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>Financial Instruments</h6>\r\n<p>36. Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>37. Most financial liabilities will be classified as subsequently measured at amortised cost. However, there are exceptions, as set out in IFRS 9.4.2.1.</p>\r\n<p>Review the entity’s financial liabilities and ensure these are appropriately classified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>38. The entity can designate, on initial recognition, a financial liability at FVTPL if:</p> <ul> <li>• doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”;</li> <li>• a group of financial assets and/or liabilities is managed and performance evaluated on a FV basis; or</li> <li>• it is a certain type of hybrid contract per 4.3.5 of IFRS 9.</li> </ul> <p>If this is the case, ensure such a liability has been treated appropriately from initial recognition</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>39. For any financial liability recognised at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p> <ul> <li>Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li> <li>Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li> <li>If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li> <li>• Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li> <li>• Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li> <li>• Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence</li> </ul> <p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p> <p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>40. If the entity has contracts with embedded derivatives, ensure these have been treated in accordance with IFRS 9.4.3.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6> <p>41. Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL. </p> <p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p> ', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

timelineData.name: Query
timelineData.query: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>42. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.7 I2', '2.7 I2', '25', 'Active', '2024-03-21 14:58:46')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Obtain schedules of payables and accruals. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Agree totals shown on the lead schedule to backing schedules and the trial balance. <strong>(E & C)</strong></p>
    [2] => <p>3.	Ensure payables are properly split between amounts due in less than one year and amounts due in more than one year.    Ensure that where balances are shown as non-current that the entity has the legal right to avoid payment for at least 12 months from the reporting date.  <strong>(R & O, P)</strong></p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Agree comparative figures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Review payables for reasonableness and consistency and ensure that related party balances have been identified. <strong>(P, C)</strong></p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Ensure key findings from this section are included in the draft letter of representation, points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [7] => <p>8.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [8] => <p>9.	Inspect board minutes, loan agreements and other evidence to ascertain whether all debentures and other loans (including bank loans) have been recorded. <strong>(V, R&O)</strong></p>
    [9] => <p>10.	Obtain counter party confirmation of all debenture and loan account balances (including bank loans).  Agree the account balances and ensure all other matters arising are dealt with. <strong>(P, R & O, E, C, V)</strong></p>
    [10] => <p>11.	Obtain details of loan covenants and consider as to whether they have been complied with. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
<i>Where a loan covenant has been breached and not rectified by the reporting date and the financial institution has not agreed by the reporting date to ‘overlook’ the breach, the entire loan must be disclosed as repayable within one year. </i>
    [11] => <p>12.	Review loan agreements (particularly bank loans) to ensure that none of the clauses within the loan agreement trigger the loan being accounted for on a fair value basis. If any loans are to be accounted for at fair value, complete test 39 below. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [12] => <p>13.	Discuss with those charged with governance whether, in relation to any loan agreements, they have entered into any interest rate swaps, cap or collar arrangements through a ‘side agreement’ or via a separate contract. <strong>(C)</strong></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Where such interest rate swaps or loans that need to be accounted for at fair value are identified, ensure the client has obtained an appropriate fair value from the counterparty and complete test 39 below. If hedge accounting is being applied, complete the tests on S2/4.</p>
    [14] => <p>15.	Where payable balances are due after more than one year, and did not carry a commercial rate of interest at inception, consider whether the time value of money is material, and if so, ensure they are accounted for on an amortised cost basis and that an appropriate discount rate has been applied.  <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [15] => <p>16.	Where loans are due after more than one year and the interest is not spread evenly over the period of the loan (for example, irregular payments throughout the loan term or a balloon payment on completion), ensure that the effective interest rate is calculated and the loan carried at amortised cost. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Ensure that cut-off has been correctly applied on loans from subsidiaries and entities in which the client has a participating interest. Specific consideration should be given to:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Management charges;</li>
    <li>Accrued interest;</li>
    <li>Dividends still to be paid.  <strong>(C)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [17] => <p>18.	Where loans payable are denominated in a foreign currency determine by reviewing the loan documentation whether the client or the counterparty bears the risk or rewards of movements in the exchange rate. <strong>(P & V)</strong></p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Obtain an aged payables’ listing and reconcile it to the trade payables figure shown on the lead schedule. <strong>(C)</strong></p>
    [19] => <p>20.	Select a sample of trade payable balances and agree / reconcile them to suppliers’ statements, direct confirmation or purchase invoices.  Where the balance is reconciled to supplier statements, follow up any reconciling items and ensure all necessary provisions are included in the financial statements. <strong>(V, R&O)</strong></p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Ensure that any payables due to be paid in foreign currency have been correctly translated at the period end rate, and ensure there is an adequate accounting policy note. <strong>(V & P)</strong></p>
    [21] => <p>22.	Ensure cut-off has been properly dealt with.  Examine goods received notes either side of the period-end date and ensure recorded in the correct accounting period.<strong> (C, V)</strong></p>
    [22] => <p>23.	Select a sample of after-date purchase invoices, cash book payments, expense claims and transactions on company credit card statements and confirm they represent post period items or are correctly recorded as payables. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>
    [23] => <p>24.	Review debit balances included on the payables’ ledger, consider whether they represent unrecorded purchases and if they are bona fide debit balances consider reclassifying as debtors.  <strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [24] => <p>25.	Check supporting documentation for material ‘other payables’, these should include:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Corporation tax;</li>
    <li>Payroll deductions;</li>
    <li>Any other material payable balances.<strong> (V, E)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [25] => <p>26.	If any finance lease individually is ‘significant’ ensure it is identified as such and suitable disclosure is included in the financial statements. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [26] => <p>27.	Obtain written confirmation of the value of any loans included in ‘other payables’, including any amounts due to related parties. <strong>(V, R & O, E)</strong></p>
    [27] => <p>28.	Ensure all secured payables, including trade payables where goods are under reservation of title (Romalpa Clause), have been identified, and that appropriate disclosure has been made regarding the security. <strong>(P, R&O)</strong></p>
    [28] => <p>29.	Ensure all payables falling partly or wholly due after more than five years have been identified, and that information relating to additional disclosure can be provided. <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [29] => <p>30.	If accruals are above performance materiality (either individually or in aggregate), then recalculate a sample from source documentation.<strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [30] => <p>31.	Review deferred income and ensure that cut-off procedures have been adequately undertaken. <strong> (C, V)</strong></p>
    [31] => <p>32.	Ensure that any dividends shown in payables are final dividends and were approved prior to the reporting date. <strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [32] => <p>33.	Ensure that any bonus shown in payables represents either a contractual or constructive obligation at the reporting date.<strong> (R&O)</strong></p>
    [33] => <p>34.	Scrutinise the purchase ledger and purchases day book for unusual items. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>
    [34] => <p>35.	Scrutinise the nominal ledger and cash book for any large or unusual items of expenditure. <strong>(CL, A, P)</strong></p>
    [35] => <h6>Financial Instruments</h6>
<p>36.	Ensure that IFRS 9 has been applied to all types of financial instruments except those set out in paragraph 2.1 of IFRS 9.</p>
    [36] => <p>37.	Most financial liabilities will be classified as subsequently measured at amortised cost. However, there are exceptions, as set out in IFRS 9.4.2.1.</p>
<p>Review the entity’s financial liabilities and ensure these are appropriately classified.</p>
    [37] => <p>38.	The entity can designate, on initial recognition, a financial liability at FVTPL if:</p>
<ul>
    <li>•	doing so mitigates an “accounting mismatch”;</li>
    <li>•	a group of financial assets and/or liabilities is managed and performance evaluated on a FV basis; or</li>
    <li>•	it is a certain type of hybrid contract per 4.3.5 of IFRS 9.</li>
</ul>
<p>If this is the case, ensure such a liability has been treated appropriately from initial recognition</p>
    [38] => <p>39.	For any financial liability recognised at fair value, carry out the following procedures (as appropriate):</p>
<ul>
    <li>Ascertain how management has determined the fair value (e.g. calculated by management; counter-party valuation received; independent third party valuation received);</li>
    <li>Assess and test the bases and assumptions used to calculate/support the fair value;</li>
    <li>If management have engaged a third party valuer, undertake the appropriate audit tests on the N audit programme to determine the reliability of the evidence obtained;</li>
    <li>•	Consider the need to appoint an auditor’s expert (as per ISA 620). If this is considered necessary, complete the relevant test on the N audit programme;</li>
    <li>•	Develop your own range of estimates of the fair value and compare against those used by management for reasonableness;</li>
    <li>•	Consider whether any events subsequent to the reporting period end up to the date of the audit report provide any audit evidence</li>
</ul>
<p>NB 1: Reliance CANNOT be placed a valuation provided by the counter-party to the financial instrument. This is due to the fact that any such valuation is not independent, and in most cases, does not provide detail of the assumptions, data or models used to support the valuation. </p>
<p>NB 2: Auditors are prohibited by the IESBA Code of Ethics from providing valuation services to audit clients where the valuation involves subjectivity and the effect is material to the financial statements.</p>
    [39] => <p>40.	If the entity has contracts with embedded derivatives, ensure these have been treated in accordance with IFRS 9.4.3.</p>
    [40] => <h6>For periods commencing on or after 1 January 2019:</h6>
<p>41.	Review loans and other debt instruments held at FVTPL for any early repayment features with negative compensation (that is, the difference between the prepayment amount and unpaid amounts of principal and interest). If the negative compensation amount is “reasonable compensation for early termination of the contract”, and the loan is held to collect, the loan can now be carried at amortised cost rather than at FVTPL. </p>
<p>Where such financial assets were previously carried at FVTPL, ensure that the transition requirements per IFRS 9.7.2.29 to 34 are complied with.</p>

    [41] => <p>42.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
